review_text: An absolute gem of a home! From the time I booked online to arriving to the AirBnB there was excellent and friendly communication with Amy/hosts. The home is charming and well appointed and I wanted for nothing. The Nespresso machine in the kitchen was a nice surprise. The washer/dryer worked well and helped me pack a lot less than needed. The home is conveniently located near the airport, MSU-Billings and Downtown and is a short drive to the West End of town. I slept peacefully each night- the neighborhood and surroundings are inviting and the fresh mountain air was invigorating! Close to the Rims, Swords park and the new running/hiking trail. I hope I find myself a guest in the home again for my next work visit to Billings!

We loved the cozy home and the decor was amazing and perfectly done. This place was very clean and the kitchen was fully stocked! We were provided with a snack basket which came in handy after we arrived from driving in from Cody that day. The location was so close to the airport which came in handy for our EARLY morning flight the next morning. If we are ever in the Billings area again we would stay here again! It was more comfortable and quiet than staying at a hotel.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
This Mini Mountain View Getaway is amazing. In the shadow of Billings Rim Rocks (sandstone cliffs that boarder the northern edge of the city), this ADU is new, modern and lovingly built by the owners. I used it as "home base" while rediscovered my hometown after a 54 years' absence.
It's a walk to MSU and just a few minutes to downtown. I saw a deer, a duck (and other fowl), and numerous rabbits who make the outskirts of Billings their home. It has a small but nice view of the Rim Rocks south of town, and I was able to watch distant thunder storms from the front porch. All-in-all, a gem of a place to stay while in Billings.

STAY HERE! Super cute. Walkable (no side walk for part of it, but totally doable), nearby lots of stuff, and overall a great location at the end of a neighborhood road.
The inside is amazing. The kitchen is perfect- dishwasher, full size fridge, dishes, cookware, and basics like pepper.
The bathroom is great too. Full-size products, a great blow dryer, and a full size washer and dryer.
The couch is comfy and the bed is great.
Everything is functional and immaculately decorated.

It was quite, tucked back, yet it was close enough to walk to the Main Street to get a bite to eat or a coffee, or walk thru some of the campus.
I highly recommend staying here!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This little place was super cute inside and out. Easy to find, the driveway/parking is a bit tricky, but not bad at all. The decor and extra touches were beautiful. I love the colors, finishes and charm. It was pretty clean. No smells, enough supplies to grab food to cook and make coffee. We enjoyed the two large TV's for movies. It was 62 degrees on arrival and did take a while to warm up. By the second day it was pretty comfortable, we also had a snow storm so the weather was nasty cold. If you go in the winter, bring some warm slippers and an extra blanket if you prefer warmer temps....it is MT! Cute little book of memories for guests, would definitely stay again! Oh, it is really close to campus, airport (which multiple planes did wake us up at 5am Friday), Billings clinic, grocery store, and some great restaurants. Only a 15 min drive to more shopping. :)

review_text: This was my second stay at one of Jenna's properties. The first was great, this one even better! The aparment was exactly as pictured, well stocked, and immaculately clean. Nice, quiet location with easy access to all of Billings. LOVED the coffee shop downstairs!! The only small issue we ran into was difficulty locking the balcony and exterior building doors. Initially was told by co-host Crystal, that this was a known problem and couldn't be fixed, which was discomforting, but a quick follow-up response from co-host Josh with the "trick" to get them locked saved the day and made us feel much more secure. This was addressed within 24 hours, and there was never an issue securing the door leading directly into the apartment, so I wouldn't consider it a major secuity problem. I would suggest informing future guests in advance of the issue and "trick" though. Overall, both my travel partner and I felt very comfortable here, and I would absolutely recommend and stay again!

As we drove up to the house, it felt like a movie set. There were friendly neighbors and families walking around outside happily greeting us. After 3 solid days of driving, this wonderful townhouse was a much needed break for us. In fact, we didn't want to leave! Our daughters absolutely loved the toy room!
The house is beautifully decorated, and we enjoyed all of the little touches like how the towels were laid out for all of us! It felt so welcoming.
We had a great night's sleep as it was so peaceful and quiet!
Since the area is so new, Google directions brought us to a closed road. As the neighborhood is being constructed, I would recommend driving to the house via Elysian Rd.
I really like that there was a washer and dryer! If you would like to do laundry, bring your own laundry detergent.

review_text: This walk-out 1 bedroom space was a great place to stay. The place was quite large and very tastefully decorated, including a colour changing electric fireplace. There was also a great sitting area in the backyard with a fire table, but we didnâ€™t use it as it was cool outside being the 2nd of May. The kitchen was well equipped and stocked with all kinds of extras such as spices, oils and Saran Wrap etc. . A Keurig was supplied along with lots of coffee pods. A nice touch was the Welcome binder with local information for things to see and do and contact information. The snack basket including popcorn and cereal bars and treats was also a plus. Location was great as well, being just off a main drag, it was very quiet and still close enough to walk to stores for shopping or lounges. The touch keypad to entrance was also nice, no key needed. Hosts were very responsive and enquired if everything was to our liking and if we needed anything else, which we didnâ€™t.

Kaleen is a wonderful host who has thought about what possible amenities one might need in the house and has made sure all of them are there for the guests. The house is super clean, the beds are comfortable, the kitchen is pristine, the deck area was free of clutter, the backyard has a hot tub and a jungle gym for activities. This is a perfect stay for a group of adults on a weekend getaway or for a family on a trip. We loved this stay and will be back.

The beds were so comfy and my sister was threatening to steal one of the pillows lol. Everything was what we needed. We enjoyed a full size fridge, with water bottles. There were 3 TVs and we enjoyed a Netflix movie one night. Because of the weather we needed to move our reservation up a day and because of the weather we needed to add a day. It was all done very quickly and respectfully. We all agreed we would stay there again as it was so close to everything and we felt safe.

As road trippers the well-running washer/dryer was our fave amenity; w/ the large TV & fast Wifi a runner-up. Kitchen isn't necessarily set up for standard home cooking - no stove or oven. But there are a lot of appliances to be able to heat or ready-made foods. A solid, graciously affordable stay - would recommend.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: When I arrived, I was a little confused because this property has multiple units and I didn't at first know which one I was staying in. Finally figured it out after going through emails from AirBnB and David. Once inside, I was very pleased with the room/apartment. Small, but very comfortable for 1 person. Was very pleased to see such a well stocked kitchen and recent renovations. I was able to settle in right away, and when my circumstances changed during my stay, I was happy that David allowed me to extend my stay, twice. Now, the negatives, which David has absolutely no control over. I had been warned by my siblings before my arrival that this is in a "sketchy" area of Billings, but I have to say I never had any problems at all in this regard. Parking is on a side street near the room, and this street intersects with a VERY busy street next to the room. Lastly, I had to run the hot water a long time before any hot water would come. Final thought, I would stay again.

name: Kimberly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our first contact was asking about parking - we have a dually that can be hard to maneuver downtown. The host was quick to respond, directed us on how to park, and would be available if needed , for our late arrival.
At first glance, we saw homeless coming up to the property. The outside of the property buildings were older and run down. When we got to our unit, it was easy to get into, clean and tidy. There was information available about our room and safety information, giving us some confidence that our vehicle would be safe outside. We did appreciate the black out window panels for added safety too.
Everything in the unit was working properly, lots of hot water for a few showers, tv worked great. Similar size to a hotel room with all the amenities of home.
It was a great place for the price, especially if you wanted to be close to downtown, like we did. For light sleepers, be warned that the street next door can be loud.
Exactly as advertised and we were happy.

review_text: This place seemed, at first, to be a bargain. However, these use to be efficiency low income housing. They are in a dangerous and unsafe part of town. There were homeless folks walking around asking for money everytime we came back. They are located on one of the busiest streets in Billings. We heard traffic all night long. We had to buy ear plugs to sleep. The inside looks nice but very small. The second night the heater went out and we had to use a cheap electric space heater to keep warm. We went to wash some clothes and the washing machine smelled so bad we had to open the window and door to air it out. We tried to clean the washer but it was no use. Lastly, my wife had morning sickness and wasn't feeling well so we were about 30 minutes late checking out. I explained this to the cleaning person and he just snapped at me. The owner called and told me we had to get out. I explained what was going on and he just said check out is at 11 your late and I should charge you another day. Wenever asked for a refund for having to sleep in the cold or not being able to do laundry and they were all extremely rude. I would find some where else to stay

review_text: David was a great host! Communication was immediate and having Alfredo on site they could fix things same day. I am a travel nurse and stayed with David for the 3 months during the Covid 19 crisis. In such uncertain times it was comforting to know I had a safe and clean place to come home to. I knew I could rely on him if I needed anything. He asked me several time if there was anything he could get for me or do to help me during the pandemic. The apartment was exactly as described and served all my needs as a travel nurse. Having laundry, full kitchen, cable/wifi and a nice updated bathroom made my day to day functioning and 15 weeks of straight overtime easier. I'd highly recommend for any travel nurse working at Billings Clinic or St.Vincent's as you can walk to the hospitals. I chose the location because it was close to downtown and I could walk to several very nice bars and restaurants. I also ran in North Park everyday.

Stayed over a week
review_text: Cozy apartment right in the middle of Billings. The outside of the building could use some TLC, but the inside is pretty nice, quiet, and comfortable. The area always seems to have a few homeless (and large rabbits?) wandering around as there is a youth shelter and a a block over is an adult shelter and soup kitchen. But I had no issues coming or going beyond just a few people trying to panhandle me when I walked a few blocks to the store. I never felt unsafe, but I did make sure to lock my car and just be aware as you do in any city. Washer and dryer was handy, kitchen had plenty of space, tv was fine, and the bed is very soft and comfortable. The fridge is full-size and the bathroom, while small, had good water pressure and hot water. My only complaints would be the wifi is not the greatest but did eventually work okay, and maybe the bed linens could be improved. But overall for the price this was an excellent stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Where should I start! It's a great airbnb and I highly recommend if you need to stay in or around Billings. I stayed at the apartment for 3 months- the location is absolutely perfect if you have work at the hospital (well the location is perfect for easy access to everything in billings). Everything in downtown billings is in walking distance, uber is also a good option if walking isn't your thing and you don't have a car. There is a parking area on the side of the apartments or street parking is free (I always parked on the street- never had any issues). Microwave, dishwasher, washer, dryer, kuerig all in the unit! The bed is heavenly! Other reviewers said the wifi was spotty- recommend sitting on the couch next to the window or at the foot of the couch (wifi is more reliable in that spot) OR they are many amazing coffee shops near by with absolutely fantastic coffee and free wifi. Others also mentioned the outside looks worrisome/ sketchy-I never had a single problem or ran into any trouble and I worked night shift- so I would go to the anytime fitness or the 24/7 Walmart at 2am and never had any issues. If I had a question about anything David would respond within minutes and alfredo was right there to help. All in all- stay here! Highly recommend!

review_text: The inside of the space is very lovely, but the outside was awful. It's hard to get past first impressions - my Lyft driver was hesitant to even drop me off - he walked me to the front door. I contacted David who was very kind/communicative. He assured me that it is a safe building and even dropped by - which I appreciated. But although walking to and from downtown was convenient - I would have rather stayed in a different area and walked/ubered/rented a car. There is a facility for runaways next door - so you have to pass a bunch of smoking teenagers that are covering the lawn - each time you go into town. I just never felt comfortable - and I lived in Downtown Atlanta for 12 years. I appreciate all of the care that went into the inside of the apartment - perhaps I would stay there if I wasn't by myself.

Now the good part, the studio is gorgeous! Everything is updated, there was cute decor, all the appliances needed with a long trip even though we were just there a weekend.

name: Sharon
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed about a week
review_text:
I stayed at Davids place for 2 days, at the beginning of my trip, but had previously booked other accommodations for about 5 days. I came back to David place for the entire 2nd week of my trip.
The location could not be better! EVERYTHING you need is literally within a 2 or 3 block radius. And being in town without a car it was perfect for my needs. I could walk for 5 to 10 min. and get to 3 popular Fast food chains, 2 Diners, a grocery store, a pharmacy, or a 24 hour gas station with a mini mart. There is also a neighborhood sports tavern right up the street with food and drinks, where you can watch a game on one of the TV's or gamble a little.
I understand that this kind of easy acccess and convenience isn't a priority for everyone. But there is a reason I didn't tell you about the laundromat that is practically across the street! And thats b'cuz Davids place has top of the line appliances, like the full sized, stacked, front loading washer and dryer! The new microwave and The Keurig coffee maker and a smart tv! There's even a dishwasher!

review_text:
Excellent Stay!!!!
From the moment I contacted David the communication was excellent. This was my first experience using Airbnb. I was nervous and didn't know what to expect. I have only one regret, that I didn't stay my first week in Billings at Davids place. First, David takes pride in what he provides for his guests and goes out of his way to accommodate his guests. He wanted to make sure our stay was comfortable and we were happy. The studio we rented was beautiful inside. The entire place is brand new. The studio was spotless, clean, and cozy. The bathroom tile is gorgeous. The shower is perfect with lots of hot water. The color scheme of the studio is professionally decorated from the tile to the color scheme. The bed was clean and comfortable. My 11 year old slept on the coach and his exact words were, "Mom I don't want to get up this coach is so comfortable." David was so nice to accommodate us with extra sheets, pillow, and blankets for my son.
The kitchen was well stocked more then we expected. In fact the entire place was stocked with hair soap, hair dryer, etc. We were able to cook every night instead of spending money to go out to eat. The best part was the laundry machines which made it so convinenant for us.
The studio is located close to downtown and convinenantly close to the highway. We felt very safe and secure in the studio.
There isn't enough good to say about this experience. If you plan to visit Billings this is the place to stay.

review_text:
Unfortunate circumstances necessitated our protracted stay in Billings with some unique mobility needs. We searched many places for reduced steps into the house, a walk-in shower, and open and single level living spaces. This was exactly the right place. There are two steps up from the garage, which were manageable. The garage itself meant we didnâ€™t have to worry about loading and unloading in uncertain conditions. The kitchen was the best stocked AirBnB kitchen Iâ€™ve ever seen! We also have two young children, and stays can be a bit nerve wracking if there are excessive decorations. Here everything was tastefully done but without dangerous fragility.
Another best-of-AirBnB qualities was our host, Megan. She was so responsive and kind, and genuinely cared about the quality of our stay. During a completely stressful time, she was a calm and steady reassurance. We just had nothing to worry about when it came to the basic and fundamental need for a safe haven. Thank you, Megan ğŸ’—

Kelvin and his family were kind enough to let us visit and help feed their cattle on their property above the bungalows too! This made my wifeâ€™s day! We keep gettin surprised with every air bnb stay we have thinking it would be impossible for a stay to be better, but this place will be hard to beat. It is literally perfect!

This vintage home has living space to spread out and stay as long as you'd like. It's located in a neighborhood of older homes on a fairly busy street, but we found it very quiet and restful. All the listed amenities were available and Heather was immediately responsive whenever I reached out. What stands out most is the loving care and design style with which Heather has retouched and redone various areas -- most notably extensive modern tile work in kitchen and bath and refinished wood floors throughout.
This is an older home and it shows its age in some spaces; for example, windows are painted shut and generally hard to open if you like fresh air. The bathroom is tiny and not easy to use.
